title: Script that works well with The Sans/PMN Caecilia?
content:
Hi,

i'm searching for a casual script that could work well with a The Sans/PMN Caecilia combination. _Casual_ is the keyword; nothing "too appealing", "too distinctive". Don't think "display", think more in the "handwritten" direction.

I'm far from being a "script guy" … ideas?

T.
author: poms

comments.content:
You could also look at [Brisa](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414112906/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/5)

(But I suspect Fresco would be a better match)

Just Lefthand, Erik Righthand. The original handwriting fonts — and Dutch too.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

Thanks for replying,

Fresco Script is "too Fresco"  
Brisa is too "wellness hotel"  
Erik Righthand is too "Poster, too black"

I know script is a highly subjective thing, that's why it might be so difficult to find s.th. right –

Ok it's time for a new expanding definition;  
A handwriting dutch thing with a more informal character.  
Something like Lucida Casual in a handwritten style :)

Gerard Ungers Flora.  
 [http://www.gerardunger.com/allmytypedesigns/allmytypedesigns07.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414112906/http:/www.gerardunger.com/allmytypedesigns/allmytypedesigns07.html "http://www.gerardunger.com/allmytypedesigns/allmytypedesigns07.html")

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

Yes Bert, good idea!

More suggestions are welcome, of course!

Have you looked at the italics on [Goudy Sans?](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414112906/http:/www.itcfonts.com/Fonts/Detail.htm?pid=202950)

Other options are:  
 [Sassoon Primary](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414112906/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/sassoon-primary/)  
 [Briem Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414112906/http:/www.linotype.com/146934/briemscriptregular-font.html?CMP=NjR8Mjkz)  
 [Barchowsky Fluent Hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414112906/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/swansbury/barchowsky-fluent-hand/)
